page.title: 01Moorland East of Langholm
page.content: There are only two major land uses in the area. Coniferous forest in the south east and moorland used as rough grazing for sheep. The sheep are only brought down to the small fields near the farm for lambing, clipping, dipping and in the winter if the weather is very bad. Some of the forest was newly planted, but most was planted about 8 years ago. One noticeble stream flows past Petreburn to join the Tarras river just west of this area. There are no industry, amenities and communictions is one unmetalled road. There is one farm in the area which makes its living from sheep.
